qas.question: People who study the anatomy of the central nervous system are known as what?
The cerebral hemispheres of the brain are called what?
The thalamus and hypothalamus comprise what region of the brain?
The midbrain region of the brain is known as what?
Clusters of small nuclei comprise what parts of the brain?

context: <a0_0>Neuroanatomists<a0_0/> usually divide the vertebrate brain into six main regions: the <a1_0>telencephalon<a1_0/> (cerebral hemispheres), <a2_0>diencephalon<a2_0/> (thalamus and hypothalamus), <a3_0>mesencephalon<a3_0/> (midbrain), cerebellum, pons, and medulla oblongata. Each of these areas has a complex internal structure. Some parts, such as the cerebral cortex and the cerebellar cortex, consist of layers that are folded or convoluted to fit within the available space. Other parts, such as the <a4_0>thalamus and hypothalamus<a4_0/>, consist of clusters of many small nuclei. Thousands of distinguishable areas can be identified within the vertebrate brain based on fine distinctions of neural structure, chemistry, and connectivity.
